website_summaries.verdict: A straightforward climbing rope that makes for the best cord for a variety of activities.
pros: Unique construction of the rope makes it smaller in diameter than other options
Rope is easy to work with in a number of climbing activities
cons: Ropes sometimes lack the proper labeling for certification

customer_reviews.title: Rope is garbage!
customer_reviews.text: 10.5mm 150' static rope. I used this rope for 1 quick rappel and I have to throw it away. I inspected the rope when it arrived and it appeared to have no issues. After the first usage though, it was very stiff to the point it could almost stand upright on it's on. I cannot trust this rope and it raises questions about the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Dave F.

customer_reviews.title: Very strong rope. Rated at 32 Kilo Newtons strength ...
customer_reviews.text: Very strong rope. Rated at 32 Kilo Newtons strength or about 7800 lbs. I put it on my main sail halyard. Much stronger than the double braided nylon I had used.. Very smooth with low stretch,
customer_reviews.author: John A Duvenez

customer_reviews.title: Keep what works.
customer_reviews.text: Another work product, our other one worked great, but after about 200 uses (on roofs) it started to fray a bit. For safety reasons we have retired the old one and replaced with another!
customer_reviews.author: Jon B

customer_reviews.title: Old and twisted
customer_reviews.text: The label says 2012. This is unacceptable for a piece of kit that literally has your life on the line. Did I use it anyways yes. It probably won't affect anything being that it was in storage. Besides for the expired date, It's a very stiff rope that twists easily. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: zap

customer_reviews.title: but seems like it'd hold me no problem
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for installing solar panels on my roof.. i'm 240 lbs and it has worked for me perfectly. I have not had a hard fall on it.. but seems like it'd hold me no problem.
customer_reviews.author: handydan

customer_reviews.title: Great durable rope, does not tangle.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this rope for a tree swing. Seems like overkill but my grand kids, big and small swing on it every week so I wanted the safest rope I could find. It was well worth the expense knowing that I have a certified rope. We had some inferior rope fail once with minor injuries but don't want to chance it again. This is a great durable rope.
customer_reviews.author: RAV

customer_reviews.title: Product color
customer_reviews.text: The rope i received is yellow, the add read that it was otange. I would like the orange that I ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get some !
customer_reviews.text: Good basic rope. A little on the stiff side though. Price was right.
customer_reviews.author: david m.

customer_reviews.title: Solid product!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the 600' rope. Used for several rappels so far, seems to be holding up quite nicely!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong!! Smooth!! Great Value!! 11mm 300ft
customer_reviews.text: 300ft 11mm orange. I've used this rope 3 times now taking groups rappeling off a 290ft cliff in Nicaragua. It's easy to tie knots and run through an ATC. I've also ascended it with petzl ascenders. It had a bit of stretch at the bottom but nothing like a dynamic rope. very smooth and stays clean. Great price. I'll probably buy the 600ft in the future. Can't beat the price. I'm curious how long the rope will last.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Metzger

customer_reviews.title: this rope has been great as a roof saftey rope
customer_reviews.text: I am a weekly rock climber and own a christmas light install business, this rope has been great as a roof saftey rope. I highly recomend. After daily use for 3 months, i hasnt shown any signs of wear.
customer_reviews.author: justin bitner

customer_reviews.title: Strongest
customer_reviews.text: This rope is amazing! I use it for Top Rope climbing and rappelling. Extremely durable, normal rope would tear up from rock drag but this seems to hold up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Was unfamiliar with Singing Rock, but bought for the ...
customer_reviews.text: Was unfamiliar with Singing Rock, but bought for the price point. Worked very well for the lifting task at hand. Product information card was informative. Would buy products again.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Rope
customer_reviews.text: If you need to perform a high accent rescue, good rope to use. Comes in various lengths, but can handle heavy loads.
customer_reviews.author: Jay M

customer_reviews.title: Used all 200 feet of it for a 10 minute ...
customer_reviews.text: Used all 200 feet of it for a 10 minute repeal and had zero issues I plan to buy again.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: ... cleaner and Singing Rock has won me over for good! They truly produce a great product
customer_reviews.text: I'm a highrise window cleaner and Singing Rock has won me over for good! They truly produce a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Casey Miller

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as pictured
customer_reviews.text: Came exactly as pictured, very good quality rope, completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a rope
customer_reviews.text: Strong! I used it to climb a tree then pull it down. It's some great rope
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This rope has been great! it is holding up well and is easy to tie knots.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Great line for single handed mast climbing work
customer_reviews.text: This lune performed well for me. A good climbing and repelling line for my line of work. A good line at a good value
customer_reviews.author: James T. Ligon

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite rope. Love the thread pattern
customer_reviews.text: My new favorite rope. Love the thread pattern. Very knotable. NFPA rated. I bought a 2nd so I could have a 50', 100', and 150'.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful well-made life safety rope nothing wrong with any of ...
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful well-made life safety rope nothing wrong with any of it performance fantastic
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: Good quality,  seems legit this far
customer_reviews.text: Has worked good so far for the 2 months I've had it
customer_reviews.author: Stewart donaldson

customer_reviews.title: Still alive so will definitely purchase again
customer_reviews.text: I've rappelled off of 20 or so bridges and cliffs since purchasing this rope and I'm still alive, so hey 5 stars :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice rope
customer_reviews.text: Product completely met my expectations. Used it in a compound z-rig pulley setup to haul a 3.2 ton boulder on rollers over level ground. I figure we put about 2000 ft-pounds on it. Worked flawlessly. And my double figure 8 knots were easy to untie after. Good rope.
customer_reviews.author: NorCal Jim

customer_reviews.title: other than it's VERY static and has a nice feel to it
customer_reviews.text: Really solid static rope. Not much to say, other than it's VERY static and has a nice feel to it, even after being pretty abused. One slight issue: it smelled really weird out of the box....Which I've never experienced with a rope That smell has since dissipated though.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Marvin

customer_reviews.title: Good product and good value for money.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product and good value for money. Used regularly to climb the mast of our boat for repairs or maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: JJC van't Pad Bosch

customer_reviews.title: Best that I've used
customer_reviews.text: I have used this rope (10.5) for about a year now with a slackline pulley system and it has held up great. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Very good rope
customer_reviews.text: This is a great rope for top rope and rappel operations, it is a more affordable than the mil-spec rope from Bluewater which is also a very good rope. No reason not to buy this rope for what you need it for.
customer_reviews.author: shane

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality rope for a reasonable price. This has become our primary rescue rope and we will be ordering more.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: excellent rope
customer_reviews.text: this rope is the best i have ever seen. it is easy to handle and is strong as an ox. i purchased it for safety lines for my tree stand.i will have no fears with this rope. i also purchased the pursik ropes loops to go along with it and the carabieners. . i will purchase again if needed and would advise anyone needing this type of rope to purchase it. it wont let you down.
customer_reviews.author: opinions are like A_ _ holes

customer_reviews.title: Not certified?  Wrong rope?
customer_reviews.text: The rope I received was not properly labled and it was not labled like the rope on the singing rock web site. Part of the certification for climbing rope is that it has to be properly labled. That is the only thing that keeps suppliers fron substituting any rope for a climbing rope. The rope itself is fine. I don't like having to make labels and buy heat shrink to make up for manufacturing deficiencies.
customer_reviews.author: Joe L. Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Good but wasn't a perfect fit for me.
customer_reviews.text: This rope is pretty stiff and has a little too much stretch for the static application I used it for (hanging a swing). Seems to be high quality though
customer_reviews.author: rin-amazon-aic

customer_reviews.title: We used these to hang our kids swings. They ...
customer_reviews.text: We used these to hang our kids swings. They have worked well so far and will update if they don't stand the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: #Rythimic😝

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: This rope looks like it will work great for my planned uses: rappelling, vertical haul line, single rope bridge...excited to try it out. My only wish is that I could have afforded a longer section of it. You see 150" in the pics.
customer_reviews.author: Avidshooter

customer_reviews.title: better than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I have made 26 rappels on this rope and it hardly shows any wear, it's gentle on my equipment too. It gets really heavy when wet and takes several days to dry. Had I been more experienced at the time I might have bought a water repellent rope. If you're not going to get it wet it doesn't matter.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzz

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I just looked at the same rope on the singing rock website and it was 60$ cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Barefoot

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great and gives me peace of mind in my climbing
customer_reviews.author: Spike

customer_reviews.title: Great stats and quality feel, but not labeled as pictured.
customer_reviews.text: Had it been labeled properly I would have given it 5 stars. Singing Rock claims they are going to start adding labels in the future.
customer_reviews.author: J E Masters

customer_reviews.title: smaller
customer_reviews.text: i bought this rope to replace my last singing rock 10.5 rope. so when i got the rope i thought is might be smaller, it is, and it is fast, with my last rope i could make a slow controlled decent with my gri gri, this rope is go and stop. not for someone who is starting to learn.
customer_reviews.author: zane

customer_reviews.title: Me like productorino
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product for the price. Now I have to type more words. 5 more to go. Ugh
customer_reviews.author: Dan M.

customer_reviews.title: First time used, worst experience ever...
customer_reviews.text: First time used, worst experience ever... Bought this rope because of it's specifications. Went to do some repelling yesterday with some friends. Did a 25' rapell , six people and all of thw sudden the rope gets ripped.... Really disappointed on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Efrain Matos

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is great rope. I've fallen twice and then had it tested, but it shows no sign of stress.
customer_reviews.author: Louis the Cat

product_meta.title: Singing Rock R44 NFPA Static Rope 11.2-mm x 200 Feet
product_meta.description: Route 44 technology developed exclusively by Singing Rock. This unique sheath-braiding technology proves there is a better way to make a rope. Route 44 is the only rope in the world to use this patented technique making the rope more perfectly round and giving the sheath a perfect blend of thickness, durability and handling characteristics. Recommended use: rescue operations, work positioning, military and police use, speleo, fixed rope for expeditions, big wall.
feature_bullets: The Package Height Of The Product Is 15 Inches
The Package Length Of The Product Is 20 Inches
The Package Width Of The Product Is 15 Inches
